page.title: 03COMMUNICATION AND TRANSPORT
page.content: { { {Transport}links in the area are in the process of being continuously improved as trade and business flourishes and the needs and general requirements of most of the surrounding local {industry}becomes greater. {Trade}along the south coast of England has benefitted by the recently opened M27 Motorway linking Southampton to Portsmouth.The M27 is made of sand,gravel,cement and a layer of tarmac going over the top surface. Traffic flow measured in July 1985 was between 1,300 and 1,500 vehicles per hour in each direction, with the majority being private cars. Minor roads link the area with the port of Southampton and the southern interland.
